Go to My GamesSkyrim and edit SkyrimPrefs.ini , find the line [Launcher] , and add bEnableFileSelection=1, so it looks like this [Launcher]
bShowAllResolutions=0
uLastAspectRatio=3
bEnableFileSelection=1
save and start the launcher, and you should get the data option to work!!

GREYED OUT DATA FILE FIX 100% WORKING:
Go to DOCUMENTS-MY GAMES-SKYRIM-SYSTEMPREF.INI- ADD 

[Launcher]
bEnableFileSelection=1

TO THE ***TOP*** OF THE TEXT FILE NOT THE BOTTOM. THIS MUST BE DONE IN THE DOCUEMNTS FOLDER. IF YOU TRY TO EDIT THE SYSTEMPREF.INI IN THE DATA GAME FOLDER **IT WILL NOT WORK**

Uploader for some reason included extraneous AND old versions of certain folders and .bsa files--in the wrong places--in this, and that's probably why so many people are having issues with it, especially if using a mod manager of any kind. I took one look at the folder contents, realized how completely f*d up it was, and downloaded another torrent; I could have spent an hour trying to organize the contents in the proper order so a stable install is possible, but I could also just download a decent torrent in even less time. Unless you are able to manually organize your load order, and then feel like researching file sizes to find out which of the extra contents are the correct version, then cleaning out the folders that don't belong and restoring the file versions that do, you shouldn't bother  with this - it was obviously put together very, very shabbily. I seriously doubt that everything will be working "properly" even if you can get the game running with this. Upload should be deleted.

Thx...this is what i wanted

CHECK IT OUT: If you have a problem with Data Files being UNSELECTABLE, find skyrimprefs.ini in your D:Program Files (x86)The Elder Scrolls V SkyrimSkyrimSkyrimPrefs.ini or similar folder. Then you need to open it in a text editor and add the following line changes: 

[Launcher]
bShowAllResolutions=0
uLastAspectRatio=2
bEnableFileSelection=1

Make sure to save it in the same spot and file type.

Thx Uploader, but we can't access the Data Files to allow the Dawnguard... This problem is fixed by copying and saving the following lines inside Skyrimprefs.ini, in Documents/My ganes/Skyrim: 

[Launcher]
bShowAllResolutions=0
uLastAspectRatio=2
bEnableFileSelection=1

Note: You have to SEARCH the Line and replace, not just copy...

This way the Data Files will be able to be clicked...
